HIS 3HITANNIC MAJESTY’S CONSUL AND POLITICAL AGENT, MUSCAT. (Copy to : The Political Resident Persian Gulf.) DISPOSAL OF EQUIPMENT AT KHOR iOLVAI. Kindly refer to your compliment slip 4/9/5/50 dated 1st November, 1950 enclosing letter No. 165/40-C dated 31st October from Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Sultanate of Muscat and Oman. 2. The local-built boat already has an outboard engine in it which could be sold with the boat if desired. The boat is at present used as a harbour launch by the iM aval caretaker at Khor Kuwai. The following is a rough description of it which will be verified at the next opportunity:- Length 25 ft., Beam 6-7 ft.. Draught 2 ft.. Strongly built of local wood. Flush strakes. Square transom cut away to take outboard motor. Painted white. Similar to dhows used for pearling but on a smaller scale. Good engine. \ ' \ CAPTAIN. SENIOR NAVAL OFFICER, PERSIAN GULF. 1^7'SULTANATE OF MUSCAT & OMAN MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS MUSCAT No* 31st* October 1950* Sir, I hare the honour to refer to your letter No*2/9/5/50, dated the 11th. October 1950, about the Naval Base at Khor Quwai. 2* A copy of this letter has been sent to the Sultan in Salaiah and I will be able to give you a reply en receipt of his instructions* In the meanwhile I would say that the Muscat Government are likely to be interested in Items 4, 8 and 9 listed in paragraph 2 of your letter. In regard to item 6 I shouldjir you would kindly let me know whether it would be possible to put an engine in this boat and use it as a harbour launch in Muscat for the Customs Department* If it is at all possible would you be kind enough to let me have full particulars of the craft. R. IT. Facilities - Khor Ktrwai, 3479a 33953 (8)SULTANATE OF MUSCAT & OMAN No. &>740-C. MINISTRY OF FOREIGN AFFAIRS MUSCAT 4th« December 1950. 4 * 5 . KHCR QUWAI, Thank you very much for your letter No.6/9/5/50> dated the 29th. November 1950. 2. The Muscat Coveriment will be most grateful if you would be kind enough to ascertain from the Senior Ifc-val Officer* Persian Gulf what he would consider to be a fair offer from the Muscat Government for the local built motor boat plus the outboard engine. Major F.C.L.Chauncy, His Britannic Majesty*s Consul, MUSCAT.V. I am to forward a copy of a letter No.P.G. 234/102/50 from the Senior Naval Officer, Persian Gulf, about Khor Kuwai Base and to ask you to inform the Sultan of Muscat as requested. Would you also ask the Sultan if he is prepared to make an offer for the property and material listed in para 2? I am to ask you to let us know as soon as the Sultan has been informed of the proposal of the Royal Navy to abandon the Khor Kuwai as a base. Major F.C.L. Ghauncy, Political -^gent, Muscat.Office of the Senior Naval Officer, Persian G-ulf. 8th. August, 1950. Ho • P .Or. 234/102/50 TK2 POLITICAL RESIDENT, PERSIA1T OULP, BAHRAIN. KHOR Kir:/AI BASE. I am to inform you that the Admiralty are not intend ing to maintain the Naval Base at Khor Kuwai, and that the nrKXE. present caretaker party will shortly be removed. However, we shall stibll moor our oil barge in the harbour and make use of the privilege of sending ships to Khor Kuv/ai for recreation and exercises without asking permission of the Sultan of Unseat. 2. I should be grateful if you would inform the Sultan of the above and ask him if he wishes to take over the property and the following iterns / ( ii ( p. ( P' (vi (vii (viii (i*; 3 2? K .W. A.G• diesel generators. 1 15 K.W. D.C. diesel generator. 1 Distilling Plant, capacity 30 tons per day. 6 Y/ooden W.T. masts ( 3 x 110 ft., 3 x 80 ft. 1 Local Built boat. 1 Pattern 9A coal range ( 200 - 280 men ) 3 Coal burning hot water boilers. Assorted electrical fittings. Assorted steel and wooden electric power and supply poles. If so,would he be prepared to make an offer to buy the above property and equipment. ( sd ) Peter Skelton. , 1 , \ M A CAPTAIN, SENIOP. NAVAL OFFICES PERSIAN GULP. )

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/5 I R. N. Facilities in Sultanate: Khor Kuwai`

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the rear to the front.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 11, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the selling of Royal Navy property following the decision to evacuate the naval base at Khor Kuwai. The papers cover the offer of the property to the Sultanate of Muscat and the discussion of prices and particulars. The correspondence is between: the Senior Naval Officer in the Persian Gulf; the British Residency, Bahrain; the Political Agent, Muscat; and Basil Woods Ballard, Minister for Foreign Affairs, Sultanate of Muscat and Oman.
